noot.compiler
Class GeneratorHelper

java.lang.Object
  noot.compiler.GeneratorHelper

public class GeneratorHelper
extends Object

The Class GeneratorHelper. This Class is here to help the Antlr generated Generator to construct the a of TAM instructions. This helper will deal with InstructionBlocks which can be referenced and jumped to by label. It will also help dealing with addressing memory locations for declared identifiers as well as helper registers. To-Do: This class should eventually extend the ScopeHelper and override closeScope() and openScope() to deal with the allocation and deallocation of memory on certain scopes. This however has been attempted in commit: 919d9f945a but unsuccessful due to unexpected behavior from the POP instruction.

Field Detail

memoryLocations

private ArrayList<MemoryLocation> memoryLocations
The memory locations. List of all currently allocated memory locations, the index of this list is used for address creation. Addresses can be accessed through addressOfMemoryLocation().

instructionBlockStack

private Stack<InstructionBlock> instructionBlockStack
The instruction block stack. At the end this will contain all instructions for the compiled program.

Constructor Detail

GeneratorHelper

public GeneratorHelper()
Instantiates a new generator helper. This will populate the instructionBlockStack with a new InstrucionBlock to access via currentBlock();

Method Detail

pushBlock

public void pushBlock()
Create a new block and push it onto the instructionBlockStack. This method will account for correct labeling of the instruction block.

pushInstructionsForPrintingString

public void pushInstructionsForPrintingString(String s)
Push instructions for printing a string. This can be used to create helpful messages for the read statement like: "Enter integer:".

Parameters:
s - the string to create instructions for

finalizeAndPrintInstructions

public void finalizeAndPrintInstructions()
Finalize and print instructions. This method should be called when all the instructions have been pushed. So the program can be printed. This will add POP and HALT instructions for cleanup and print the result to System.out.

declare

public void declare(DeclarationNode declaration)
Declare a DeclarationNode. This should be called to create the appropriate space on the stack to store an Identifier. A MemoryLocation will be added and you can access this location through addressOfIdentifier(IdentifierNode inode) where the inode has the same DeclarationNode as used here.

Parameters:
declaration - the declaration node

allocHelperRegister

public MemoryLocation allocHelperRegister()
Alloc helper register and return the memory location of it. Get a new helper memory location to use with for example the print statement to store temporary values. This will also add instructions to create the appropriate space on the stack to store the helper register.

Returns:
the new memory location

addressOfIdentifier

public String addressOfIdentifier(IdentifierNode node)
                           throws GeneratorException
Get the address of the MemoryLocation for an Identifier. This address should be used to access the value stored within the Identifier. A GeneratorException will be thrown if the Identifier has not been allocated.

Parameters:
node - the identifier node to get the address for
Returns:
the address to be used in instructions for example the LOAD instruction
Throws:
GeneratorException - the generator exception

addressOfMemoryLocation

public String addressOfMemoryLocation(MemoryLocation ml)
                               throws GeneratorException
Get the address of a MemoryLocation. This address should be used to access the value stored within a helper register. A GeneratorException will be thrown if the MemoryLocation has not been allocated.

Parameters:
ml - the MemoryLocation
Returns:
the address to be used in instructions for example the LOAD instruction
Throws:
GeneratorException - the generator exception

currentBlock

public InstructionBlock currentBlock()
The last added instruction block. This method should be used when pushing new instructions to the program. For example by currentBlock().push(Instruction i);

Returns:
the current instruction block
